title: What channel is Sheffield Utd v Arsenal on? TV and live stream information
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Arsenal FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Arsenal will be looking to continue their unbeaten run when they travel to Sheffield United on Monday night.

The Gunners have lost just once in the Premier League this season - at Premier League leaders Liverpool - and will move up to third in the table with victory at Bramall Lane.

Meanwhile, the Blades are looking to continue their solid start to life in the top flight following promotion last season.

However, Chris Wilder's side are without a win in their last two outings and will be hoping to get back on track and pull away from the relegation zone.

Here's all you need to know ahead of the game:

(Image: Arsenal FC via Getty Images)

When is Sheffield United vs Arsenal?

The match will kick off at Bramall Lane at 8pm on Monday October 21.

Where can I watch it?

The game will be televised on Sky Sports Premier League. Coverage begins at 7pm.

Will it be live streamed?

The match will be live streamed on the Sky Sports app for Sky Sports customers.

Alternatively, you can follow all of the action with Mirror Sport's live blog.

(Image: REUTERS)

Odds

Sheffield United: 14/5

Draw: 19/4

Arsenal: 19/20

courtesy of The Pools
description: The Gunners will move up to third in the table with victory at Bramall Lane
